speaker: TAGLINE
line: DIE WAHRHEIT IST IRGENDWO DA DRAUßEN

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Oi! Easy! Easy! Steady up! Hold on, mates. He's almost up. That's it. Give it a big pull! That's it. Don't drop him now. Come on! Pull him over! Put your backs into it! Come on!

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: There he goes. Lots of life in him. Give it up, Matey. Good for ya. That's what you get for your trouble.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Maybe he's just taking a long swim.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Yeah. Or a short flight. You an airman, Mate? Oi?

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: No, he's not dressed like an airman.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: What kind of uniform is that, then? Sprechen sie deutsche, jah?

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: I say he's a rat and we throw him overboard like a rat.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Right. Let's give him the heave-ho!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey …

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: How's about another dip in the Atlantic, huh, dirty Jerry?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Even the sharks won't eat him.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Oi! What you got to say for yourself, Jerry, before we throw you back in?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name's not Jerry.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: What's that? Eh?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name's Mulder. Fox Mulder.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: That a name? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I got ID in my pocket.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: "Fox Mulder, Federal Bureau of Investigation." Sorry, mate, never heard of it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Never heard of it?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Tell you what we do with foxes. Care to know?

speaker: MULDER
line: You never heard of the FBI?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Why don't you shut up, Jerry, before we change our minds here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you taking me?

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Where'd you pick up that accent?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Probably in the Fuhrer's Secret Service. Come on.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: I say we cut him open and see what color he bleeds. Dirty Jerry. Deutschland Uber Alles.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Deutschland Uber Alles"? Wait a second.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Oi, how's about you shove a cork in it, mate. All right?

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Eh? What's this about?

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Found him in the water, sir. Don't know nothing about him. I think he's a German.

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Bring the prisoner in my room.

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Friend or foe?

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: To what flag do you pledge allegiance?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think there's been a mistake. I think the mistake is mine.

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Speak the truth, man.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the Queen Anne, isn't it?

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Aye.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, just about enough of that. I came looking for this ship.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Say the word, Captain, I'll make him the first of the rest.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold on a second. I think I can explain what's going on.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: It's a ruse, Captain.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's our current position?

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Cut the spy up.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll tell you. I'll tell you. We're two degrees above the 30th parallel. Sargasso Sea. Just above the Tropic of Cancer. 64 degrees West by Southwest. Off the Plantagenet bank 60 miles South-southwest off Bermuda. How would I know that if I'd been in the water?

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: Aye, that's a damn good question, lad. I'm waiting for a damn good answer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me I'm wrong. Tell me that you haven't been able to get accurate compass readings. That navigation's been a real bitch. It's because you've been caught in something called "The Devil's Triangle." I can show you on the chart here. It goes from Bermuda down to Puerto Rico and back up to Florida. The Queen Anne is stuck here on the Eastern edge of it. You've been caught in some kind of time warp. In some kind of limbo dimension and now you've popped out the other side into 1998.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: This man is mad.

speaker: SAILOR 3
line: Let him tell it to the fishes.

speaker: CAPTAIN HARBURG
line: I'm done fooling about, man. There's a war on. And in it or no, I don't plan to lose me mind nor me ship to the likes of a jackal like you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can relax. There's no war going on. The world is at peace. There's a little trouble over at our White House but that'll blow over, so to speak.

speaker: CAPTAIN MARBURG
line: Peace? It's September 3rd, 1939, man! Hitler has entered Poland. And we've just been boarded by a bunch of his goose-stepping hooligans so don't speak to me of peace, lad. Tell Mother England.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no. It's not September 3rd. It's November 16th. Look.

speaker: FIRST MATE
line: Excuse me, captain.

speaker: CAPTAIN MARBURG
line: Aye.

speaker: FIRST MATE
line: Sir, the Germans, sir. They've taken control of the bridge. Steering a course for their homeland.

speaker: CAPTAIN MARBURG
line: Not on the watch of captain Yip Harburg, they're not. Lock the prisoner up in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's okay. The war's over. Let them take you to Germany. They make nice cars.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is unbelievable.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mayday, mayday. This is Special Agent Fox Mulder with the FBI. I'm on the SS Queen Anne. Ship in distress. Mayday, mayday.

speaker: RADIO
line: The British ambassador in Berlin handed the German government a final note stating that unless we heard from them that they are prepared at once to withdraw their troops from Poland a state of war would exist between us. No such undertaking has been received. Consequently, as of today, September 3, 1939 this country is at war with Germany.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, sh….

speaker: GERMAN SOLDIER
line: Hello? Sind Sie da drinnen? Hallo? Ist da jemand? Hello?

speaker: RADIO
line: CLOSING OF PLACES OF ENTERTAINMENT: All cinemas, theatres and other places of entertainment are to be closed immediately until further notice. The evacuation of British children is going on smoothly and efficiently. The ministry of health says that great progress...

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell is going on? Spender?

speaker: NAZI 1
line: He, hast du was gefunden? Bleib doch stehen! Hörst du nicht? Umdrehen! Hast du was gefunden? Warten Sie mal! Halt, stehen bleiben! Warten Sie! Maenner, kommt rueber! Wo kann er denn sein? MULDER doesn't answer or turn around. The NAZI SOLDIERS are no longer friendly.)

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Halt! Mach Schnell! Da rechts! Da rechts! Da rechts!

speaker: SINGER
line: IT'S GOT TO BE SUNNY TO ME WHEN YOUR EYES LOOK INTO MINE JEEPERS CREEPERS, WHERE'D YOU GET THOSE PEEPERS? GOSH, OH, GET UP, HOW'D THEY GET SO LIT UP?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: SINGER
line: JEEPERS CREEPERS, WHERE'D YOU GET THOSE PEEPERS?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: I suggest you get your Nazi paws off me before you get one in the kisser.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me, Mulder.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Oh, you speak English, do you? Well, how'd you like to see the stars on the American flag?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not a Nazi.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Oh, sure. You just look like one, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: I had to steal this uniform. Scully?

speaker: SINGER
line: Hier ist der mann, den sie vollen!

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Halt! Hande hoch! Hande hoch!

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: He said, "Put your hands up."

speaker: MULDER
line: You see, I told you.

speaker: SINGER
line: JEEPERS CREEPERS …

speaker: MULDER
line: You're all big men now but wait until you get into Russia. Hope you fellas like the cold.

speaker: SINGER
line: ...WHERE'D YOU GET THOSE EYES? HUSH, OH, GET UP, HOW'D THEY GET SO LIT UP?

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Auf schnell! Du hast Glueck, dass wir dich nicht sofort abknallen!

speaker: MULDER
line: Same to you, Adolf!

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Schnauze!

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Los! Mach schon.

speaker: NAZI OFFICER
line: Bringen sie dieses schiff auf fahrtrichtung Deutschland oder wir schaffen sie vom steuer weg. Verstanden?

speaker: CAPTAIN MARBURG
line: I'll not give up this ship!

speaker: NAZI OFFICER
line: Zeig ihm was ich meine.

speaker: CAPTAIN MARBURG
line: You can put me down, man, but I'll not let go of this wheel so 'till we meet in hell...

speaker: NAZI OFFICER
line: Ershiess ihn.

speaker: FIRST MATE
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: You...

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Wer ist dieser mann?

speaker: NAZI 2
line: Er hat einen meiner leute zusammengeschlagen und seine uniform gestohlen. Er ist spion.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Wo sind die waffen versteckt?

speaker: MULDER
line: No sprechen.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Die waffen haben sie an bord, nicht?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't speak Nazi.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Erschiess ihn auch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute. Why are you shooting me? Why are you killing me? What have I done? I don't understand what you're asking me.

speaker: 1939 SKINNER NAZI
line: Halt! Nicht schiessen. Dieser mann ist Amerikaner. Es heisst sie vollen mehr leute an dem krieg beteiligen.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Bring ihn nach unten. Bring alle nach unten.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner? Where are they taking me? Help me, Skinner!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you guys doing here?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Mulder's in trouble.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Big trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: BYERS
line: Let's take a walk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, where are we going?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The walls have ears.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have ears. Will you tell me what's going on?

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder's disappeared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Disappeared from where?

speaker: LANGLY
line: From the national reconnaissance office's lacrosse mid-latitude imaging radar satellite.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand. What am I looking at?

speaker: FOWLEY
line: A whole lot of nothing.

speaker: BYERS
line: We pulled that down 45 minutes ago off the NRO satellite, which early this morning sent a picture of a ship which inexplicably appeared in the middle of the Atlantic.

speaker: LANGLY
line: The SS Queen Anne which by all accounts vanished without a trace over sixty years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Queen Anne? The British luxury liner?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's correct.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was torpedoed by a German U-boat.

speaker: LANGLY
line: That's one story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's another?

speaker: BYERS
line: Though her exact position was kept secret for fear spies might give her up to the Axis. It's been reasonably determined that the Queen Anne was just south of the Plantagenet bank when she went missing.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Less than sixty feet of water yet she's never been found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're saying the Queen Anne just disappeared.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Into the Bermuda triangle.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And reappeared this morning at 6:49 a.m. Eastern Standard Time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's impossible.

speaker: BYERS
line: Satellite doesn't lie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's nothing on here.

speaker: BYERS
line: We gave the original images to Mulder so he could use them as navigational aids.

speaker: LANGLY
line: He was in a hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To get where?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Out to the Queen Anne before anyone else got there first.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's gone out here?

speaker: BYERS
line: He went to Bermuda and chartered a powerboat out of Hamilton Harbor. We tracked him on the satellite for an hour and a half.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Until a storm blew in and obscured all transmissions.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's what you're holding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's happened to him?

speaker: BYERS
line: We can't know that. Not without alternative tracking data. Which is why we're here.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Without good data, all we can do is wait and hope for the best.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, but expect the worst.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we have to get help.

speaker: BYERS
line: Without a position he's a needle in a haystack.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you need?

speaker: BYERS
line: Navy AWACS SLAR or SAR 100 K swath imaging. You're going to have to find somebody at the Pentagon to get it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait for me downstairs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to speak with him.

speaker: SKINNER'S SECRETARY
line: Could you please take a seat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he in?

speaker: SKINNER'S SECRETARY
line: Yes, he's on his phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry, this can't wait.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Could you hold on a minute? What is it, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just received some very disturbing information, sir. I need your help.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll call you back in five. You can't come rushing in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, I couldn't waste time explaining myself to your assistant.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tell me what is so urgent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's about Agent Mulder. He's done something incredibly rash.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He may be lost at sea.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can't what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't help you. There's nothing I can do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn't for me; it's for Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: My hands are tied. I'm not your direct superior any longer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't you want to know what this is about?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I don't. I don't even what to hear it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, this is about a man's life.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not allowed to have contact with you-- any contact with either you or Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER'S SECRETARY
line: She walked right past me, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're out of line, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir, you're out of line. I'm sorry, but I'm coming to you for help and I've got nowhere else to go. I would hope that after everything that we have been through that you would at least have the courtesy and the decency and not to mention the respect to listen to what I have to say. Now, all I need is information. You don't have to do anything else. Look, sir, if you know anybody at the Office of Naval Intelligence it would be of great help.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I could lose my job, my pension, I could even be subject to legal action.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Use your head, Scully. It'll save your ass.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Save your own ass, sir. You'll save your head along with it.

speaker: WOMAN IN THE ELEVATOR
line: Ouch!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry.

speaker: KERSH'S SECRETARY
line: Yes, sir, I'll get those files and make that call and buzz you when I have him on the line.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need a word with AD Kersh.

speaker: KERSH'S SECRETARY
line: I'm sorry, he's not available.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Assistant Director Kersh, may I please have a moment of your time?

speaker: AD KERSH
line: A moment for what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, may I, sir? Thank you. Sir, I need you to get me some information. I am not a liberty to say why but I can tell you it is of the utmost importance…

speaker: AD KERSH
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: . I, uh... Sorry. I shouldn't have come unannounced.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: May I see what you were going to show me, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh... It's nothing, really.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: Good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I thinking? What am I thinking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, come on, come on, come on, come on. Answer the phone, Mulder. Answer the phone, answer the phone, answer the phone.

speaker: RECORDED VOICE
line: The cellular customer you are trying to reach is not responding or is …

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to do me a favor. It's not negotiable. Either you do it or I kill you. You understand?

speaker: SPENDER
line: You okay, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm not. I'm a gun ready to go off so don't test me, Spender. Don't even think about trying to weasel me.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What is it that you need?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Navy AWACS SLAR 100 K swath. South-southeast of Bermuda. I am looking for a boat, maybe a ship. 1939 luxury liner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't ask too many questions. I don't care what you do or who you do or who you have to grease, I need that information and I need it now. Are we clear on that?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Crystal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And, Agent Spender... If you're not back in a hurry I am going to hunt you down, and so help me God...

speaker: SPENDER
line: Right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: CSM
line: Agent Fowley?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: CSM
line: I was looking for Agent Spender.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, he's not here right now. Is there something I can help you with?

speaker: CSM
line: Yeah, Agent Scully just handed the Assistant Director a piece of paper with an intelligence system scribbled on it.. .

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes? Yes, sir?

speaker: CSM
line: Who is this?

speaker: KERSH'S SECRETARY
line: Oh, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just, uh...

speaker: KERSH'S SECRETARY
line: I was sent to come get you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I was waiting for Agent Spender, he was, uh... I'm supposed to pick up a delivery from him.

speaker: KERSH'S SECRETARY
line: Agent Spender is with Assistant Director Kersh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That rat bastard!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stupid!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully. Mulder? Is that you? No, I can't... I'm on an elevator. Hold on, I'll be off in a s... Hold on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? No... I can't understand. I can't...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Was that you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've been trying to reach you. I got the information you needed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't even ask.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, what you've done...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is save Mulder's ass. I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And if you ever ask me to break policy or protocol I will have you written up, wrapped up and tossed out of the FBI for good. Am I understood, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: BYERS
line: Did you get it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Oi... American, right? Saved your life, mate. Krauts don't want no reason to bring you Yanks into the war.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got two words for you, buddy-- Pearl Harbor.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: After Poland, Hitler's on his way to Denmark, Holland and France with a few stops in between. The French all but roll over on us, the Italians seize their opportunity and the Japanese come through the back door. It's a long, bloody story. It fortunately has a happy ending.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: We win?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, you come out on the side of history with no small amount of help from us. Not much to apologize over the next 50 years except for maybe the Spice Girls.

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Schnauze halten, verdammt noch mal! Raus mir euch! Vorwaerts, worauf wartet ihr? Mach schon! Los!

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Well... According to our host this'll be our new accommodations, lads.

speaker: MULDER
line: You speak German. What was that shouting about up there?

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: They got it in mind that we left America carrying arms to England.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are we?

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Listen, she's drawing 16 feet at 81,000 tons. We're making 21 knots at full power. If we got munitions aboard this ship, mate, they don't weigh but a few stone.

speaker: MULDER
line: But the Captain knew something. He wouldn't give up the wheel.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: The Nazis boarded us after they intercepted a radio communication... Some kind of code word they keep asking about-- Thor's Hammer. You know what that is, mate?

speaker: CREWMAN 1
line: Who go there? I said, "who goes there?"

speaker: CREWMAN 2
line: Show your faces or we'll bloody beat them to a stub.

speaker: SAILOR
line: Put your irons down, boys. It's your own crew, for God's sake.

speaker: CREWMAN 2
line: What're you doing down here?

speaker: SAILOR
line: We're having a cup of tea. What's it look like, you stupid swabbo?

speaker: CREWMAN 2
line: Then who's steering the boat?

speaker: SAILOR 3
line: Oh, just some blokes who answer to the name of Heil Hitler.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: You ever been to Germany, swabbo? They'll have a special affection for the likes of you.

speaker: SAILOR 4
line: Yeah, right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, this ship can't go to Germany.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Make up your mind, mate.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got news for you-- you're not carrying munitions. It's something far more deadly.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Thor's Hammer?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thor's Hammer isn't a weapon. It's a man, a man who will help build a weapon-- a bomb that'll win the war for whoever has it.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: And you're telling me he's aboard this ship?

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw him in the ballroom.

speaker: SAILOR 1
line: Sein name ist Thor's Hammer. Er hat einen plan, eine bombe zu bauen. Auf wiedersehen... Mates.

speaker: CREWMAN 2
line: What's wrong with you?! Don't you know there are spies everywhere?! Trust no one, mon!

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Look, we've got to stop this ship-- now! All right, lads, let's go!

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Hey, hey, who's in charge of this engine room? Oh, you. Oi, you! I'm talking to you. Shut her down, man. We got to scuttle her now!

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: Put some piss into her, boys.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Hey, you heard him-- kill the engines! There's no other way, swabbo.

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: You can't get to Germany if you can't steer. Me overriding her. We steering a course for home.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Have you looked at your compass? You can't get to England going the wrong bloody direction.

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: We're not going to England. We're going to Jamaica.

speaker: CREWMEN
line: Yeah!

speaker: SAILOR 3
line: Listen, you steer her home, you bloody ruffo-- to her home where she belongs!

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen to me! Listen to me! You can't take this ship to England. You'll never make it.

speaker: CREWMEN AND SAILORS
line: What are you talking about? I'm in charge of the wheel!

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: There's only one place she's going, Yank. Jamaica!

speaker: CREWMWN
line: Yeah!

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't take the ship to Jamaica, either. The Germans will hunt you down no matter what course you steer.

speaker: CREWMEN
line: No! No! Hear it out. Hear it out. Hear it out.

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: And who you be, boy?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name's Mulder.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: He wants to go back to bloody America.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I want you to take this ship and turn it back around the way you came.

speaker: CREWMEN AND SAILORS
line: No! No!

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: Bloody hell, we're halfway home!

speaker: MULDER
line: You've got to turn the ship around.

speaker: CREWMAN 3
line: And what's in that direction?

speaker: MULDER
line: The future.

speaker: SAILOR 2
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, the past.

speaker: SAILOR 3
line: Hmm? Oh, well, I'm convinced.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I can explain it to you.

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Du! Der Amerikaner. Du kommst mit uns, rauf hier. Ja, mit kommen. --

speaker: MULDER
line: Turn the ship around or Hitler rises, Germany wins and your children will never know what freedom is!

speaker: NAZI 1
line: Halt! Halt! Stehen bleiben! Stehen bleiben oder ich schiesse! Stehen bleiben! --

speaker: NAZI
line: Achtung!

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Aufstehen. Mach schnell! Get up! Er sagte...

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Wir haben einen mann an bord, einen wissenschaftler der weiss wie man eine bombe macht die den krieg gewinnin wird. Frag ihn, wer dieser mann ist.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: There's a scientist on board who can make a bomb. Who is this man?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Waffe bereit. -

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Sag ihm, wir werden einen passagier umbringen fuer jede falsche antwort.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: You will answer the question or we will begin killing passengers. Which one is the scientist?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Schiess ihn.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Frag ihn, wie viele personen er sterben lasst.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: How many lives are you willing to sacrifice?

speaker: MULDER
line: None.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Then you have the answer. Er weigert sich ihn zu nennen.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Schiess nochmal.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Stop! This man has no answers. You're killing innocent people to learn that he knows nothing!

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Shut up. Shut up and move away.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Listen to me, you little weasel...

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Wir haben unseren naechsten passagier, eine dame. Richte die waffe auf sie. Schiess sie... Wenn er die frage nicht beantwortet.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Answer the question.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll answer the question.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Beantworte die frage.

speaker: MULDER
line: That man is the scientist.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, Scully, you're not going to believe this. Get up here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The sky just cleared and there it was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it the Queen Anne?

speaker: BYERS
line: That's her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe it.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Seeing is believing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They've got power.

speaker: BYERS
line: Maybe Mulder's already on board.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's hope he is.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: You're lying.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: He's telling the truth.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Shut up! Who is the scientist?

speaker: MULDER
line: I told you, this man is the scientist.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: Officer!

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Frag ihn, wie der mann heisst?

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: What is the man's name?

speaker: MULDER
line: John Brown. Ask me again, and I'll knock you down.

speaker: 1939 SPENDER
line: What's his name?!

speaker: MULDER
line: Puddintame. Ask me again and I'll tell you the same.

speaker: SCIENTIST
line: Wait. Don't shoot. I'm the scientist.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: This man's a liar. I'm the scientist.

speaker: SCIENTIST
line: Please-- tell them the truth before someone else has to die.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: I don't know this man.

speaker: SCIENTIST
line: Please don't listen to her. She's traveling with me to protect me. She works for the OSS.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's great.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: I don't see you did any better.

speaker: 1939 CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN
line: Toete sie zuerst. Toete sie alle.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd he say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh...I think I know what he said.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: You learn fast.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: What's happening?

speaker: MULDER
line: The engines shut down.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Hey, what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come with me.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Why should I?

speaker: MULDER
line: 'Cause you're the only one who can save this ship. Come on.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on.

speaker: NAZI
line: Stehen bleiben! Stehen bleiben... Oder ich erscheisse sie. Hande hoche... Hintr irhen kopfe. Machen sies!

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Now what, Einstein?

speaker: NAZI
line: Machen sies! -

speaker: 1939 SKINNER
line: God bless America. Now get your asses out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Byers? Langly? Frohike?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on... Come on!

speaker: SCULLY
line: There you guys are.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: What are you doing?!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to tell you how to save this ship.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Out here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't stay. I got to get back to history.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: And you got to rescue it. Wait. Listen to me. This ship's been caught in something called the devil's triangle. It's some kind of time warp-- a rift in space.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Are you crazy?

speaker: MULDER
line: You know Einstein, right? He predicts the theoretical possibility. He also predicts an atomic weapon that will destroy the world.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Yeah? So what?

speaker: MULDER
line: If you don't go back and convince the crew of this ship to turn this ship around and head back into the devil's triangle everything Einstein predicted will become true-- except for the outcome of history.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: So, if I don't turn this ship around...?

speaker: MULDER
line: In all likelihood, I won't exist.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Oh...

speaker: MULDER
line: And neither will you.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Okay...

speaker: MULDER
line: So, in case we never meet again...

speaker: MULDER
line: I was expecting a left.

speaker: 1939 SCULLY
line: Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder, it's me. Hmm?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where am I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in a hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ooooo.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lie still.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel... Like hell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't blame you. You've been through the wringer, I'd say.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You did something incredibly stupid.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did I do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You went looking for a ship, Mulder. In the Bermuda Triangle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Say that again?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Gilligan awakes.

speaker: MULDER
line: You were there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm?

speaker: MULDER
line: You were there, Scully.

speaker: LANGLY
line: He's delirious.

speaker: MULDER
line: And he was there, too.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Right-- Me and my dog Toto.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you were there with the Nazis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, will you settle down? It's an order.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not that he takes orders...

speaker: MULDER
line: You saved the world, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah... You're right. I did.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What kind of drugs is he on?

speaker: LANGLY
line: I want some.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no.... The Queen Anne-- I found it. You were there with Thor's Hammer. I told you you had to turn the ship around and then I jumped overboard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I bet you did. The boat that you were on was busted into a million pieces. And as for the Queen Anne it was nothing more than a ghost ship.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no. You and I were on that ship, Scully. In 1939.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get some rest, Mulder, 'cause when you get out of here I'm going to kick your butt but good.

speaker: MULDER
line: I would've never seen you again. But you believed me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In your dreams. Mulder, I want you to close your eyes and I want you to think to yourself "there's no place like home."

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: I love you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, brother...
